intro: Sphaeralcea rotundifolia, commonly known as the roundleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its spherical, yellowish flower heads that resemble small globes, surrounded by broad, rounded leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Sphaeralcea rotundifolia is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
